/etc/orthanc
C://orthanc/orthanc
Hello blank fragment Main Tab 1 Tab 2 SEACH STUDY PATIENTS GENERAL HTTP DICOM NETWORK ADVANCED Name of server: Settings
Messages Sync
Your signature Default reply action
Sync email periodically Download incoming attachments Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested The logical name of this instance of Orthanc. This one is displayed in Orthanc Explorer and at the URI \"/system\" Server name Storage Directory Path to the directory that holds the heavyweight files (i.e. the raw DICOM instances). Backslashes must be either escaped by doubling them, or replaced by forward slashes "/" Index Directory Path to the directory that holds the SQLite index (if unset, the value of StorageDirectory is used). This index could be stored a RAM-drive or a SSD device for performance reasons Storage Compression Enable the transparent compression of the DICOM instances Maximum Storage Size Maximum size of the storage in MB (a value of "0" indicates no limit on the storage size) Maximum Patient Count Maximum number of patients that can be stored at a given time in the storage (a value of \"0\" indicates no limit on the number of patients) Concurrent Jobs Maximum number of processing jobs that are simultaneously running at any given time. A value of \"0\" indicates to use all the available CPU logical cores. To emulate Orthanc <= 1.3.2, set this value to \"1\". Configuration of the HTTP server HTTP Server Enabled> Enable the HTTP server. If this parameter is set to "false", Orthanc acts as a pure DICOM server. The REST API and Orthanc Explorer will not be available HTTP Port HTTP port for the REST services and for the GUI HTTP Describe Errors When the following option is \"true\", if an error is encountered while calling the REST API, a JSON message describing the error is put in the HTTP answer. This feature can be disabled if the HTTP client does not properly handles such answers HttpCompressionEnabled Enable HTTP compression to improve network bandwidth utilization, at the expense of more computations on the server. Orthanc supports the \"gzip\" and \"deflate\" HTTP encodings Configuration of the DICOM server Dicom Server Enabled Enable the DICOM server. If this parameter is set to "false", Orthanc acts as a pure REST server. It will not be possible to receive files or to do query/retrieve through the DICOM protocol. DicomAet The DICOM Application Entity Title Dicom Check Called Aet Check whether the called AET corresponds to the AET of Orthanc during an incoming DICOM SCU request Dicom Port Dicom Port Default Encoding The default encoding that is assumed for DICOM files without \"SpecificCharacterSet\" DICOM tag, and that is used when answering C-Find requests (including worklists). The allowed values are \"Ascii\", \"Utf8\", \"Latin1\", \"Latin2\", \"Latin3\", \"Latin4\", \"Latin5\", \"Cyrillic\", \"Windows1251\", \"Arabic\", \"Greek\", \"Hebrew\", \"Thai\", \"Japanese\", and \"Chinese\" Deflated Transfer The transfer syntaxe The transfer syntaxe Jpeg Transfer "Jpeg2000 Transfer " Jpeg Lossless Transfer Jpip Transfer Mpeg2 Transfer Rle Transfer Unknown Sop Class Accepted Whether Orthanc accepts to act as C-Store SCP for unknown storage SOP classes (aka. \"promiscuous mode\") Dicom Scp Timeout Set the timeout (in seconds) after which the DICOM associations are closed by the Orthanc SCP (server) if no further DIMSE command is received from the SCU (client) Security-related options for the HTTP server Registered Users The list of the registered users. Because Orthanc uses HTTP Basic Authentication, the passwords are stored as plain text Whether remote hosts can connect to the HTTP server Remote Access Allowed Whether or not SSL is enabled SSL Enabled SSL Certificate Path to the SSL certificate in the PEM format (meaningful only if SSL is enabled) Authentication Enabled Whether or not the password protection is enabled Network topology Dicom Modalities In Database Whether to store the DICOM modalities in the Orthanc database instead of in this configuration file (new in Orthanc 1.5.0) Dicom Always Allow Echo Whether the Orthanc SCP allows incoming C-Echo requests, even from SCU modalities it does not know about (i.e. that are not listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above). Orthanc 1.3.0 is the only version to behave as if this argument was set to \"false\" Dicom Always Allow Store Whether the Orthanc SCP allows incoming C-Store requests, even from SCU modalities it does not know about (i.e. that are not listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above) Dicom Check Modality Host Whether Orthanc checks the IP/hostname address of the remote modality initiating a DICOM connection (as listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above). If this option is set to \"false\", Orthanc only checks the AET of the remote modality Dicom Scu Timeout The timeout (in seconds) after which the DICOM associations are considered as closed by the Orthanc SCU (client) if the remote DICOM SCP (server) does not answer Orthanc Peers In Database Whether to store the Orthanc peers in the Orthanc database instead of in this configuration file (new in Orthanc 1.5.0) HTTP Proxy Parameters of the HTTP proxy to be used by Orthanc. If set to the empty string, no HTTP proxy is used. For instance: \"HttpProxy\" : \"192.168.0.1:3128\" \"HttpProxy\" : \"proxyUser:proxyPassword@192.168.0.1:3128\" HTTP Verbose If set to \"true\", debug messages from libcurl will be issued whenever Orthanc makes an outgoing HTTP request. This is notably useful to debug HTTPS-related problems HTTP Timeout Set the timeout for HTTP requests issued by Orthanc (in seconds) HTTPS Verify Peers Enable the verification of the peers during HTTPS requests. This option must be set to \"false\" if using self-signed certificates. Pay attention that setting this option to \"false\" results in security risks! Reference: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html HTTPS CA Certificates Enable the verification of the peers during HTTPS requests. This option must be set to \"false\" if using self-signed certificates. Pay attention that setting this option to \"false\" results in security risks! Reference: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html Advanced options
> >
